poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: I'm a hag-ridden nag - or could I be the nightmare itself? Let's say the former: get up every evening to race, More quarantine gurney than horse, negotiate damaged goods the receding System's put my way but don't win clear To the dappled charge, to career across the land bridge. Otherwise, a bureaucrat To test your wit and tax your strength. So Go and have a swim, it'll do you good. There's three old ladies peching to stay afloat And a woman in her 20s whose husband will be at work. Go on. Wake up.
